> =
On Thu, 2010-12-02 at 23:40 -0800, Bill Venners wrote:
> > I had forgotten =
I even wrote that article. It is quite verbose what I
> ended
> > up needin=
g to do to test a private method in Java.
>
> I personally think that every=
 method needs testing; it's a basic part of
> "divide and conquer". It seem=
s bizarre to me that people seriously
> believe only public API methods nee=
d testing. Smells a bit
> ideological...
>

Agreed. More generally, I think=
 that any code that can potentially break
needs to be tested.

Saying that =
private methods need to be tested through public API's only is
the same as =
saying that you don't need unit testing since you are already
doing integra=
tion testing.
